answers.label: ANSWERS
answers.title: Answers per day
answers.subtitle: Children answer up to 1,200 questions a day in the Evolytes game

minutes.label: MINUTES
minutes.title: Average time spent
minutes.subtitle: Children spend on average 26 minutes each time they open the game

research.subtitle: Evolytes is based on 3 years of interdisciplinary research in computer science and psychology to make learning fun, engaging and to improve skill acquisition. The results of the experiment behind the Evolytes platform exceeded our wildest expectations.
research.answers12: Children with learning disabilities showed the greatest growth throughout the study
research.answers1200: Children answered up to 1,200 questions a day in the Evolytes game in their own free time of their own volition
research.answers4: Children answered on average 4 times more questions in Evolytes than at school throughout the study

theory.reinforcementDescription: Makes the game entertaining and rewards students to keep them engaged
theory.flowDescription: Used to adapt to the skill level of each student to maximize their potential
theory.spacingDescription: Ensures long-term learning and skill acquisition by spacing practice
theory.skillDescription: We use new developments in skill acquisition research to measure and assess skills
theory.multimodalDescription: By learning in different environments, students are better at recalling those skills in real life
theory.mindsetDescription: Used to assess and display student progress in the platform

books.subtitle: The Evolytes books are specifically designed to practise reading and writing skills in a fun and unique way.
books.skillsSubtitle: The books are designed to practise reading and writing skills in order to improve learning outcomes.
books.integrationSubtitle: The books integrate with the game through chapter exams which makes learning fun and engaging.
books.rewardsSubtitle: Children are rewarded in the game for working in the books which makes them excited to learn maths using books!

integrationGame.title: All Evolytes books integrate with the game in a unique way
integrationGame.subtitle: The Evolytes books integrate with the game through QR codes followed by an exam. If children answer correctly, they get in-game rewards to keep them motivated!
integrationGame.step1Description: Children learn how to solve new problems in the Evolytes books in each chapter.
integrationGame.step2Description: At the end of the chapter, scan the QR code to take an exam to review the chapter.
integrationGame.step3Description: When children successfully complete an exam, they receive a reward.
integrationGame.step4Description: In the Monitor you can see how your child is advancing in the books and which chapters they have finished or are struggling with.

shop.subtitle: We offer several books for different ages and skill levels. We are constantly adding new books with new features, creatures and adventures.
shop.errorFetchBook: Sorry, something's wrong during the fetch of the books

features.title: Features
features.description: The Evolytes books offer various unique features to make learning maths fun and engaging in the Evolytes universe

feature1.title: Improved learning outcomes and positive attitude towards maths
feature1.description1: Students learn maths in a fun way in the books through the Evolytes and the unique information about them.
feature1.description2: By integrating the books with the game, children finish the Evolytes books in record time, improve their learning outcomes and become more positive towards maths.

feature2.title: Designed to teach children to solve new maths problems
feature2.description1: The Evolytes teach children how to solve new maths problems in the books. In each chapter students get step-by-step instructions on how to solve new maths problems with the help of an Evolyte!
feature2.description2: The books have been designed by our artists and illustrators who have decades of experience in design and illustration.

feature3.title: Integrated with the platform
feature3.description1: The Evolytes books introduce game elements and creatures from the Evolytes universe while teaching children maths.
feature3.description2: The books integrate with the game through QR codes at the end of each chapter. The codes link to exams, which are directly tied to the content. If children successfully finish the exam, they get rewards. The in-game rewards motivate students to finish the books in record time. Teachers can see the students' progress in the books and any chapters the student struggles with in the Monitor.

game.subtitle: The Evolytes game rivals the games children play for fun and makes learning maths fun and engaging.

math.title: Making maths fun
math.subtitle: The Evolytes game makes learning maths fun through a high-quality game, beautiful creatures, engaging universe and exciting adventures.

explanations.subtitle1: In order to catch, play or compete with other creatures, children have to answer maths questions.
explanations.subtitle2: As children play the game more, the creatures learn new abilities and evolve.
explanations.subtitle3: Choose your character and discover the ever-expanding Evolytes universe and its stories.
explanations.subtitle4: There are various chests in the universe where children have to answer questions to open them and gain rewards!

character.title: Choose your character
character.subtitle: Children get to choose which character and companion creature to play in the game. Each creature belongs to a family of evolutions to choose from.

story.title: Get to know the story
story.subtitle: Children follow the story of 4 friends who are discovering their Evolyte companions. Watch their introduction below.

evolve.title: Collect and evolve
evolve.explanation1: Every Evolyte has multiple evolutions which grants them unique abilities to discover.
evolve.explanation2: Every Evolyte belong to a family tree which outlines its different possible evolutions. Every family has its unique characteristics.

engaged.title: Evolytes is designed to keep your child entertained and engaged
engaged.subtitle: Evolytes is based on several years of research and uses leading psychological theories to improve learning outcomes and keep your child engaged.

platform.title: Evolytes platform
platform.subtitle: Learn more about how the books, game and Monitor make Evolytes a leading maths learning platform.
platform.booksSubtitle: The Evolytes books are specifically designed to teach reading and writing skills and integrate with the game
platform.monitorSubtitle: Get in-depth learning insights into strengths and areas of improvement in real time with the Monitor
platform.gameSubtitle: The Evolytes game makes learning maths fun and engaging while adapting to children's skill levels to maximize their potential

monitor.subtitle: The monitor give you real time insights into your childs learning progress, strengths and weakness

overview.title: Real-time overview
overview.subtitle: Children learn faster and more effectively with Evolytes. Don't take our word for it: follow their progress in real time in the Monitor

explanations.subtitle1: Get a clear overview of your child's progress in the dashboard.
explanations.subtitle2: In the activity section of the dashboard, you can see usage statistics for your child.
explanations.subtitle3: Be up to date on your child's progress in the books and what they are struggling with.
explanations.subtitle4: You can see patterns emerge based on all of the questions your child has answered.

features.title: Features
features.subtitle: The Monitor is constantly evolving and offers various features to give you an overview of your child's learning progress, strengths and areas of improvement.

explanation.title: Real-time overview of your child's progress
explanation.subtitle1: The dashboard gives you a simple and effective overview of your child's activity, progress in the books and skill evolutions.
explanation.subtitle2: The dashboard is the perfect place to keep up to date with your child's maths learning.

skills.title: See your child's skills evolve over time
skills.subtitle: In the monitor you can see how your child's skills evolve over time and how they are progressing. This can help you identify problem areas and stay on top of your child's skill acquisition.

book.title: View your child's progress in the books
book.subtitle1: With the book and game integration you can get insights into your child's progress in the books, the chapters they have finished and the chapters they are struggling with.

answers.title: Get in-depth analysis in the answers section
answers.subtitle: In the answers section you can filter and analyze all of your child's answers in one place, allowing you to uncover trends and difficult areas. This feature enables you to analyse children's answers at a deeper level to understand where problems occur.

Subscriptions.title: Subscriptions
Subscriptions.subtitle: Various subscription plans are available to transform the way your child learns maths.

Subscriptions.shortDescription: Evolytes iPad App and Access to the Evolytes Monitor.

freeTrial.title: Trial
freeTrial.startTrialMessage: You are about to start a 7 day free trial of Evolytes. We do not require a credit card or any payment information. We hope your child enjoys the Evolytes universe and learns as much as possible during your trial!

Learning.endingText: Start empowering your child or students with the Evolytes platform today.

landing.tagline: Learn maths in a fun and engaging way
landing.description: Use the Evolytes game and books to teach children maths faster, in a fun and engaging way. The platform is designed for children aged 5—9 years old.

evolytesPart.title: Changing the way children learn
evolytesPart.description: The Evolytes platform combines the Evolytes game, books and Monitor to improve learning outcomes.
evolytesPart.gameDescription: The Evolytes game makes learning maths fun in a open world with various adventures.
evolytesPart.bookDescription: The Evolytes books are specifically designed to develop reading and writing skills.
evolytesPart.monitorDescription: With monitor you can have a real-time overview of children learning progress, strengths and weaknesses.

universePart.title: The Evolytes universe
universePart.description: The Evolytes universe, its characters and stories will keep your child calculating maths at an incredible pace.

howPart.title: How Evolytes works
howPart.description1: Children play in the Evolytes game where they answer maths questions to advance in the game.
howPart.description2: As the child answers more questions, the questions adapt to the child's skill level.
howPart.description3: Children work in the books and use the QR codes at the end of each chapter to take an exam and get rewards.
howPart.description4: Teachers and parents can monitor the child's progress, strengths and areas of improvement in the monitoring section.

researchPart.title: Founded in research
researchPart.description: Evolytes is based on many years of research and uses leading psychological theories to improve learning outcomes and keep your child engaged.

featureSection.title: Feature Requests
featureSection.description: We work closely with our partnering schools to create the best math educational platform out there. If you have any features you would like us to add feel free to reach out, we always love fresh new ideas!

schoolSection.title: Evolytes in schools
schoolSection.description: Evolytes has a special version and pricing for schools. Learn why over 50% of schools in Iceland use Evolytes.

1.text: A couple of students have started the Evolytes adventure. This is AMAZING. We have seen tremendous growth immediately from our students! Huge compliments from us! There were several teachers green with envy who want to add their students to the Evolytes platform.

2.text: Usually games that teach you something are childish and boring. Evolytes is not like that...

supportPart.title: Support
supportPart.description: The Evolytes platform received support from the Technology Development Fund and the Innovation Center of Iceland, which were crucial to the development of the platform.

introduction.title: Evolytes for schools
introduction.subtitle: Evolytes has been specifically designed for schools, in close collaboration with our partners. We want to empower teachers with modern tools to help their students succeed

tool.title: Tools for teachers
tool.subtitle: The Evolytes Platform is designed to empower teachers and students. The monitor gives teachers real-time insights into students' progress, strengths and areas of improvement.

tool.gameDescription: Students answer a maths question in order to operations in the game such as catching and feeding Evolytes.

engaging.title: Engaging students
engaging.subtitle: The Evolytes game and books are designed to keep students engaged, interested and calculating maths based on their skill level to maximize their potential.
engaging.individualizedSubtitle1: The core of the Evolytes platform is the real-time assessment where students are provided with individualized content based on their skill level.
engaging.individualizedSubtitle2: Teachers get a clear overview and insights into their students' learning progress to address problem areas. The platform saves teachers a great deal of time, which goes into student assessment.
engaging.dashboardSubtitle: In the Monitor teachers have a real-time overview and insights into their students' learning. The student gets individualized content based on their level.

keeping.title: Keeping students engaged
keeping.description1: Evolytes is a high-quality game which rivals the games children play for fun in their own free time. The game is designed to make learning maths fun and engaging through the Evolytes universe, its stories and characters.
keeping.description2: Students learn faster in the Evolytes game, spend more time learning maths at home and are more positive towards maths in all its forms.
keeping.pictureSubtitle: Evolytes features a rich open world with dozens of creatures, quests and stories to keep students engaged and learning!

If students successfully finish the exam, they get rewards. The in-game rewards motivate students to finish the books in record time. Teachers can see their students' progress in the books and any chapters students struggle with in the Monitor.

research.title: Based on research
research.subtitle: Evolytes is based on 3 years of interdisciplinary research in computer science and psychology to make learning fun, engaging and improving skill acquisition. The results of the experiment behind the Evolytes platform exceeded our wildest expectations

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Before you go to the trouble of calling or emailing us, our frequently asked questions could help you find a quick solution.
faq.a1:
Evolytes is design for children 5 - 9 years old. These ages are for reference and may vary depending on your child's skill level. 

 Evolytes works great for all kinds of children who are taking their first steps in maths. Evolytes is very often used by children with learning deficiencies from 6 - 12 years old as it speeds up skill acquisition and provides individualized content in real time. Evolytes has also been used with great results with younger chidlren who are learning to count. If you believe your child is ready to learn maths just go for it! Evolytes will adapt the content to their skill level.

Evolytes is used by children aged 3-16 years old. It all depends on each and every individual although the educational content is designed for children aged 5 - 9 years old.
faq.q2: Which devices and operating systems is Evolytes compatible with?
faq.a2:
The Evolytes game is currently only compatible with iOS tablets (Apple iPda). In February 2022 we will be releasing a new cross platform version for all iOS and Android devices.

 The Evolytes webpage and monitor are compatible with majority of browsers for majority of screen sizes.

Evolytes books are physical books and therefore do not require any devices to use them.
faq.q3: How does the Evolytes book integration work with the game and Monitor?
faq.a3:
You can only scan QR codes in Evolytes books in the Evolytes mobile game.

Open the Evolytes game and select the user who owns the book you are using. In the main screen of the game you will see several buttons in the upper right corner. Press the button with the camera icon. It is important to grant the game access to the camera of the device or the game will be unable to scan the QR code. You will need to access your devices settings and give it access to the camera.

Now aim the camera on the QR code which you will scan. When the game has recognized the QR code the gray button in the middle of the screen will turn green. When the button turns green you can press it and you will be prompted with a chapter exam.
faq.q4: How do I scan a QR code in an Evolytes book?
faq.a4:
Evolytes books integrate with the Evolytes platform through QR codes in the Evolytes mobile game. The QR codes can be found at the end of each chapter in the books. The QR codes can only be scanned in the Evolytes mobile game app. You cannot use the built in camera app to scan the QR code in the books.

 Each QR code in the books will test the student's knowledge of the contents of the chapter and if they answer 80% of the questions correctly in the chapter they will get a reward in game for finishing the chapter. This method allows us to positively associated writing skills with positive stimuli of the Evolytes mobile game.

By logging into the Evolytes platform on the web you can monitor your child's maths progress and their progress in the Evolytes books.
faq.q5: The camera does not work in the app. How do I fix it?
faq.a5:
If the camera does not work in the Evolytes game it is most likely due to the fact that the app has not been granted access to the device's camera. You will need to exit the game and go to the device's settings to change its access rights.

 In Settings you need to find your the Evolytes mobile game in your list of apps and allow it to access the devices camera. When the app has been granted access to the camera you can open the Evolytes game and the camera should work.
faq.a6:
The Evolytes maths platform is based on unique interdisciplinary research where leading psychological theories were used to speed up student skill acquisition in maths. Prior studies and experiments enabled us to speed up student skill acquisition to make learning faster, more effective while staying fun and engaging.

The book integration with the Evolytes platform is a unique feature which was developed to ensure student develop reading and writing skills which will improve their learning outcomes and grades.
faq.a7:
Evolytes gives your child the foundation they need in mathematics, both phrasing and number sense associated. We regularly add new maths content. Currently we go over the following maths content:

Counting, connecting amounts with numbers.

Addition 1-999

Subtraction 1-999

Unit house, units, tens and hundreds

Addition of multiple parameters

Multiplication

Algebra

Paterns

Comparing sizes (Great than, smaller than, etc...)

Forms

Decoding.

We regularly add new content to the game so this list is not exhaustive and we will keep adding content so the app can grow with your child's maths progression.
faq.q8: How do I change or cancel my subscription?
faq.a8:
You can cancel or modify your subscription by logging in to your user on the Evolytes web platform.

Log into the Evolytes monitor on this page, select the child you want to modify the billing information for. Go to settings, billing information and press modify subscription.
faq.q9: What languages is Evolytes available in?
faq.a9:
Evolytes is available in Icelandic, English and French. 

Evolytes will soon be available in Swedish, Norwegian and German.
faq.a10: In order to the Evolytes monitor to show data your child needs to start playing the Evolytes mobile game. If still nothing is displayed it may be due to the fact that your not connected to the internet.
faq.q11: Can I share my Monitor access with a parent or teacher?
faq.a11:
In order to share your access to a student with another parent, guardian or teacher you will need to send us an email at evolytes@evolytes.com and formally request that the data will be shared with another user. In order for us to process the request you will need to provide the following information:

The email used to log into Evolytes
The name of the child you want to share your access for

The email of the user you want to share access with.

The person whom you want to share your access to will receive an email so they can activate their account. They will then be able to visualize the students progress in the monitor and open the Evolytes mobile game with their credentials and select the child as an account to play.
faq.q12: How does Evolytes adapt to my child's / student's level ?
faq.a12:
All of the answers your child provides while learning in Evolytes are used to assess its skill level. We will then adapt the content based on your child's strenghts and weaknesses.

The platform adapts the difficulty of the content based on your child's answers in real time. All children start with easy material which is then made harder based on the student's proficiency.

Children will keep getting questions for skills we know they have developed in order to develop long term skill acquisition and does not forget what they have learned previously. If the student starts to struggle with material they have mastered before they will have to practice it again and the question type associated with it will start being prompted more often again.

aboutUs.title: Changing the way children learn maths

ourStory.title: Our story
ourStory.description: One of our founders, Mathieu Grettir Skúlason, saw his sister struggle with maths at home and realized he could apply his research in psychology to help her learn maths. He carried out an experiment that had very encouraging results, which ultimately led to the development of Evolytes.

y2014.title: Interdisciplinary research which the Evolytes game is based on
y2014.description: The Evolytes game was based on three years of interdisciplinary research in reinforcement theory by Mathieu Grettir Skúlason in the Aperio honors program at Reykjavík University, which started in 2014.

y2016.title: Experiment to speed up mathematics skill acquisition
y2016.description: In 2016 Mathieu came home to his sister struggling with maths where he realized he could apply his research to make learning maths fun and engaging. Following his epiphany, he developed a prototype video game that he used in an experiment to see its effect on learning. The results were beyond his wildest expectation.

y2017.title: Golden egg business planning competition - 3rd place
y2017.description: The experimental results were so encouraging that Mathieu took the project to the Golden Egg business planning competition. Jónas Ingi Valdimarsson and Íris Eva Gísladóttir joined the project where they fledged out the vision of the company which would later become Evolytes. The project was awarded 3rd place out of over 250 other teams.

y2017bis.title: Startup Reykjavík Accelerator and grants
y2017bis.description: Following the Golden Egg business competition, the project took part in the Startup Reykjavík business accelerator under the name Flow Education. The project received a capital increase of 2.4 million ISK for 6% share in the company as part of their participation in the accelerator. The project received grants from the Technology Development Fund of Iceland and the Innovation Center of Iceland.

y2018.title: Grant received from the Technology Development Fund of Iceland
y2018.description: Evolytes received a two year grant, worth 20 million ISK, to develop the Evolytes platform and get it to market in Iceland. The grant played a crucial role in making Evolytes what it is today.

y2020.title: Evolytes launched in Iceland in spring
y2020.description: Evolytes was released in late March of 2020 with a warm reception from consumers. Schools showed a great interest in the platform as Evolytes was used in 15 schools during the school year of 2020-2021.

y2021.title: Evolytes used in over 50% of Icelandic schools
y2021.description: Evolytes is used by over 50% of all schools in Iceland, making it the dominant maths learning platform in the country. We’re very excited to change the way children learn and empower teachers with modern tools.

team.title: The team
team.description: The team behind Evolytes has decades of experience and a vast interdisciplinary skill set ranging from psychology, pedagogy and research to illustration, game development and software engineering

exp.title: Experimental result
exp.conclusion: Students were given the Evolytes game to play at home outside of schools hours, where it was stressed they had to play it in their own free time. Their performance was compared to their maths activity at school.

positiveTowards.title: Positive attitude towards Maths
positiveTowards.descr1: At the end of the study, all students had more positive feelings associated with maths. No matter the form of maths, students were more open to studying mathematics.
positiveTowards.descr2: By providing students with individualized content, in a fun and engaging way, students associate positive feelings with maths and gain the confidence they need to keep studying.

theoretical.title: Theoretical foundation
theoretical.description: The Evolytes platform uses several different psychological theories to improve learning and skill acquisition while making the process fun and engaging.

history.title: Research history
history.description: Evolytes is based on several years of research in psychology to make learning fun and engaging.

y2014.title: Effects of variable and fixed reinforcement schedules on children’s responding in video games
y2014.descr1: Our first study set out to shed light on patterns of responding of children for different reinforcement schedules in video games. Various experiments have shown humans to be insensitive to the schedules and their patterns deviate significantly from what is observed with infrahuman species.
y2014.descr2: The results showed that only fixed ratio had a similar pattern of responding as seen in simpler species. Others schedules showed uncharacteristic patterns of responding for variable ratio, fixed interval and variable interval reinforcement schedules.

y2015.title: Effects of age and gender on responding to variable and fixed rates of reinforcement in video games
y2015.descr1: After having studied the patterns of responding in our first experiment, we set out to see if age and gender has an effect on resonding patterns under different rates of reinforcement.
y2015.descr2: The results showed that age had an effect on patterns of responding, specifically the rate of reinforcement and how long participants were active throughout the reinforcement schedule. Younger children showed greater sensitivity to the different reinforcement schedules than older ones. This may be due to the fact that children have a shorter reinforcement history than older students.

y2016.title: Applied reinforcement theory in video games to speed up mathematical skill acquisition
y2016.descr1: Based on our prior experiments, we created a video game based on an optimal reinforcement strategy to incentivize 4th grade students to learn maths faster at home in their own free time.
y2016.descr2: The results showed that students answered on average 4 times more questions in the game compared to the same period at school and up to 1,200 questions a day. Students with learning disabilities showed the greatest growth in answering answered up to 12 times more questions compared to at school. At the end of the study all students were more positive towards maths.

confirmSubscription.deliverySubtitle: Tracked delivery, should arrive in 3-5 business days.
confirmSubscription.companyInformationString: Evolytes ehf., registration number: 600617-1250, vat id: 128833. Address: Bankastræti 5, 101 Reykjavík, Iceland.
confirmSubscription.tcLinkMessage: Terms and Conditions and the Refund and Cancellation policy.

billingInformation.subscriptionExistsMessage: A subscription for the student already exists. You will be taken to the students dashboard.

billingComplete.title: Thank you for the purchase!
billingComplete.subtitle: You have received an email with the confirmation of your purchase.
billingComplete.subtitleTwo: We hope you will enjoy watching your child’s mathematics ability grow faster and more effectively! Get started by pressing the button below.

bookIntro.title: Evolytes book
bookIntro.subtitle: The Evolytes book should arrive within 3-5 working days to the shipping address provided during checkout.

gameIntro.title: Evolytes iPad Game
gameIntro.subtitle: The evolytes iPad game is accessible on the app store. You use the same login credentials to login into the game.

monitorIntro.title: Evolytes Monitor
monitorIntro.subtitle: You can use the Evolytes monitor at any time through the web to monitor your child's activity, progress and skills in real time.

dashboard.noQRScannedMessage: Progress in the Evolytes book will be displayed here once the student has scanned a QR code in the book and answered its questions.
dashboard.noAnswersMessage: The answers will be displayed here once the student has started playing.
dashboard.noProfileMessage: To start playing, you need to download the application.

books.noFailedTitle: You do not need help with a chapter

groups.title: Groups
groups.updateGroupMessage: The group information has been successfully updated.
groups.deleteGroupModalWarning: You are about to delete a group, this action cannot be undone, are you sure you want to proceed?
groups.deleteStudentFromGroupModalSuccess: The student has been successfully removed from the group.
groups.deleteTeacherFromGroupModalSuccess: The teacher has been successfully removed from the group.

students.title: Students
students.studentsCreatedModalMessage: The students were successfully created and added.
students.updateStudentMessage: The student information has been successfully updated.
students.deleteStudentModalWarning: You are about to delete a student, this action cannot be undone, are you sure you want to proceed?
students.deleteStudentModalSuccess: The student account was successfully deleted.

teachers.title: Teachers
teachers.updateTeacherMessage: The teacher information has been successfully updated.
teachers.deleteTeacherModalWarning: You are about to delete a teacher, this action cannot be undone.
teachers.deleteTeacherModalMessage: The teacher, student access and other data have been successfully deleted.

teachersInvitations.updateTeacherInvitationMessage: The teacher invitation information has been successfully updated.
teachersInvitations.resendTeacherInvitationModalWarning: You are about to resend an invitation email to a teacher, this action cannot be undone.
teachersInvitations.resendTeacherInvitationModalMessage: The teacher invitation have been successfully resent.
teachersInvitations.deleteTeacherInvitationModalWarning: You are about to delete a teacher invitation, this action cannot be undone.
teachersInvitations.deleteTeacherInvitationModalMessage: The teacher invitation have been successfully deleted.

schoolInvitation.title: You have been invited to
schoolInvitation.subtitle: You were invited to the school with the following account type
schoolInvitation.wrongAccountMessagePartOne: The email of the currently logged in user does not match the invitation email.
schoolInvitation.wrongAccountMessagePartTwo: Logout to create an account with the invitation.
schoolInvitation.wrongAccountMessageTwoPartOne: The email of the invitation matches with an existing account.
schoolInvitation.wrongAccountMessageTwoPartTwo: Login to access to the invitation.
schoolInvitation.wrongTokenTypeMessage: The link that was used does not have the correct format. Request a new invite from a school administrator.
schoolInvitation.tokenExpired: The invite link has expired, talk to a school administrator to get a new invitation
schoolInvitation.firstNameRequiredError: In order to accept the invitation you need to provide a first name.
schoolInvitation.lastNameRequiredError: In order to accept the invitation you need to provide a last name.

reusable.unknownError: An unknown error occurred, try again later.

profileSettings.profileDesc: Here you can manage majority of the settings surrounding your account.
profileSettings.infoDesc: This information is used to contact you and authenticate your account.
profileSettings.languageDesc: You can change your language settings. If you need to change regions you will have to contact us via email.
profileSettings.deleteDesc: Deleting account is permanent and it deletes all child accounts associated with it and cancels all subscriptions. This action cannot be undone.

passwordSettings.passwordDesc: Below you can change your password and other authentication methods when they are added.
passwordSettings.changeDesc: Input your current password and confirm it with your new password.

newBillingSettings.billingDesc: Here you can see the billing status for student accounts. In order to get your billing history for each account go to manage billing for that account.

accountSettings.accountsDesc: You can edit the information for the selecte dstudent account such as name, language and other related information.

authSettings.authDesc: Below you can activate and use different authentication methods for students. You can still login through your own account. This is an additional authentication mechanism for student accounts only.
authSettings.qrCodeDesc: You can use a QR code so that the child can login to their account in the Evolytes game. The QR Code works like a password so if a third party gets ahold of it you can generate a new one and invalidate the old code. You can print the code and keep where your child has easy access to it
authSettings.pinDesc: If you have multiple child accounts you can add a four number PIN so that children or students cannot switch between accounts. In order to get into the selected account the child or student will have to use their PIN.
authSettings.emailDesc: If your child has an email account you can create an email and password, you will need to confirm the email so that your child can login with it into the game.

videos.videoDescription: Learn how we log in and switch between students
Learn about Evolytes’ Monitor.  How we check a students status and study answering patterns.
Learn about account settings, i.e. how to change email and password.
Learn how to log into the game and pick/switch students.
Learn about the 4 main user interface buttons of the Evolytes game.
Learn how matches work in the Evolytes game.
Learn how to use the crystals to collect new Evolytes.
Learn about the layout of island 1 and where important things are located.
Learn how we use the admin system to control teachers and students in your school.

errors.LicenseLimitReached: You have reached your license limit. Delete a student or buy extra licenses.
